messages.message: hi team, i was looking into a bug report here (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05BJCNKZAM/p1744646048737159). I looked into the code a bit and I believe the issue stems from this block of code (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/b4d1796e69931c3dfd985aeef834840af31e5f7c/shared-utils/py-utils/ocr-client-lib/src/py/instabase/ocr/client/libs/ibocr.py#L4486-L4493). Do we know what the behavior should be if `bbox_confidence = None`? Should we set the confidence to 0 if we aren't able to define it?

It seems that we have the following. I can make something analogous here.
```if bbox_word_confidence is None:
  return None```

the code block you linked is trying to populate a dictionary called `bbox_ocr_confidences`

if `bbox_confidence` is None, myabe we just shouldn't put `bbox_confidence` into `bbox_ocr_confidences`?

then later on, bc we don't have a value in `bbox_ocr_confidences` for this word on this line, yes we'll probably hit this if statement and return None
```if bbox_word_confidence is None:
  return None```
